alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 1:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Scott, northeastern Muscatine and southeastern Cedar Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 146 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rochester, or 9 miles east of West Branch, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Atalissa around 150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wilton and Durant. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 260 and 281. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
